citations.narrative:
Two Australian Shepherd dogs, a 9 year old female named Bindi and Crikey a 5 year old male, were not properly
identified at the time of inspection. Each were being identified by a spherical dog tag containing the letters USDA and an
indistinguishable number. Appropriate identification allows for efficient tracking of individual animals for inventory,
disposition, transport, and healthcare. The licensee must identify each regulated animal and assure that all dogs are
identified as required. Dog identification tags must be easily readable and include the following, the letters "USDA", a
number identifying the exhibitor (ie USDA certificate number), and numbers identifying the animal.
To be corrected by August 7, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.51(b) 
   
Form of official tag. 
Two Australian Shepherd dogs, a 9 year old female named Bindi and Crikey a 5 year old male, were not properly 
identified at the time of inspection. Each were being identified by a spherical dog tag containing the letters USDA and an 
indistinguishable number. Appropriate identification allows for efficient tracking of individual animals for inventory, 
disposition, transport, and healthcare. The licensee must identify each regulated animal and assure that all dogs are 
identified as required. Dog identification tags must be easily readable and include the following, the letters "USDA", a 
number identifying the exhibitor (ie USDA certificate number), and numbers identifying the animal. 
 
To be corrected by August 7, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
